Text:
(She said she'd talk to the spirits and send them
back to their world, but...)
Hey, what's that?

(But she really seems to be enjoying the festival.
Well, fine by me.)

That's called "cotton candy." It's fluffy like
cotton and sweet like candy.

Wow, what interesting food. Hehe. This festival is
fascinating. There are so many things I've never seen
before.
Haha...

(This is totally a Japanese-style festival. No
wonder there are so many things Violet has never
seen before...)

Hey, what's that "Goldfish Scooping" over there? Do
you get the latest scoop on goldfish or something?
Contemplating the nature of goldfish may actually be
quite deep...

It's not that serious. You catch goldfish from a tank
using a paper net that easily tears.

If you try to scoop them up with force, the paper
will tear right away. The trick is to observe the
fish carefully and do it gently.

So, they deliberately use fragile paper to adjust the
difficulty. Sounds fun.
Want to give it a try?

I'll pass for now. I plan on visiting all the stalls
tonight. I need to gather intel and get a general
idea of what's going on first.
You're really planning to go all out, aren't you?

Opportunities like this are rare. I need to make the
most of it. What's next...? Oh?

Hey, that stall over there seems different from the
others. Everyone looks so serious and focused. What
kind of stall is that?

That's..."candy carving." You cut out shapes like
animals or flowers from a candy board using a
needle.

They're just cutting out shapes from a candy board?
Why are they so engrossed in something so simple? It
looks like a children's game...

Heh... You underestimate it. Do you think they'd
take a childish game so seriously?
W-Well, when you put it that way...

If my memory serves me right, carving the candy
requires both precision and boldness. It's an
advance and intellectual game. And it seems there's
a prize this time.

I see... Since you speak so highly of it, I'll give
it a try. The prize is enticing too.

I'll use that price money to conquer all the stalls
tonight.
(She's surprisingly shrewd...)
Alright, let's do this!

...Ah, it broke again. It shatters with just one
poke. Am I really doing this right...?

You are. You're just applying too much force,
Violet. You need to be especially careful with the
detailed parts.

I thought I was being careful...but if it's
breaking, then it's not good enough. Can you give me
some tips?

Well... If it were me, I'd leave the detailed parts
for later and start with the bigger sections.

True, that sounds like it could work. You know a lot
about candy carving too, not just shooting
games. You're full of surprises.

It's not that I know a lot... It's common knowledge
that the detailed parts should be left for last.

Alright, I'll follow your advice and start by
carefully cutting out the bigger parts. Let's see...

Oh, it seems to be looking better than before,
doesn't it?

Yes, I think so. Slowly and carefully... I won't use
too much pressure for the finer details...

...H-Hey, don't you think you're being a little too
careful?
Carefully...carefully...

(N-No good... She's completely in her own world.
This might take a while...)
Violet, I'm going to check out the other stalls.

So this is the "candy carving" you mentioned...
Quite the intriguing game.

Right? It looks simple, but is actually quite
challenging. Violet is totally absorbed in it.
Violet, how's it going?
Hehe. Look at this. I'm making good progress, right?

Wait, isn't that the same shape you were working on
before I left...? Have you been working on it the
whole time?

Yes, of course. Following your advice, I'm working
on it carefully and steadily. Thanks to you, it's
going well.

Still, don't you think you're being a little too
careful?

Taking time and working on one thing diligently is
my specialty. I'll keep focusing on this one.
(This is going to take forever...)

What should we do? Want to check out the other
stalls?

That's not a bad idea... But how about we observe
her efforts? She's trying hard, and I'd like to
cheer her on.
Yes, I can imagine so.

(It seems unlikely we'll conquer all the stalls...
but they both seem to be enjoying themselves, so I
guess it's fine.)
